body:
`actix-web` v4.2.1 is released and should fix this issue.

Run `cargo update` and `cargo tree -i actix-http` to verify which version is being used.

Apologies for the oversight.

issue.title: "the trait bound `actix_http::header::ExtendedValue: std::cmp::Eq` is not satisfied" when use zip crate

repository.name: actix-web
repository.description: Actix Web is a powerful, pragmatic, and extremely fast web framework for Rust.

issue.body:
## Expected Behavior
_actix-web_ must be compiled when using _zip_ crate in dependencies

## Current Behavior
Failed to compile _actix-web_ when use _zip_ crate in dependencies with this error:
```
Compiling actix-web v4.2.0
error[E0277]: the trait bound `actix_http::header::ExtendedValue: std::cmp::Eq` is not satisfied
  --> /Users/user/.cargo/registry/src/github.com-1ecc6299db9ec823/actix-web-4.2.0/src/http/header/content_disposition.rs:99:17
   |
82 | #[derive(Clone, Debug, PartialEq, Eq)]
   |                                   -- in this derive macro expansion
...
99 |     FilenameExt(ExtendedValue),
   |                 ^^^^^^^^^^^^^ the trait `std::cmp::Eq` is not implemented for `actix_http::header::ExtendedValue`
   |
note: required by a bound in `AssertParamIsEq`
   = note: this error originates in the derive macro `Eq` (in Nightly builds, run with -Z macro-backtrace for more info)

For more information about this error, try `rustc --explain E0277`.
error: could not compile `actix-web` due to previous error
```

## Steps to Reproduce
1. `cargo init`
2. add this to Cargo.toml:
```toml
[dependencies]
actix-web = "4"
zip = "0.6"
```
3. `cargo run`

## Environment
- MacBook Air (M1, 2020).
- Macos 12.5.1 (21G83).
- Rust Version: `rustc 1.63.0`
- Actix Web Version: `v4.2.0`

body: @robjtede I've pinned this to let users know that the issue has been fixed in the latest version, feel free to unpin once you assume most users update their deps :)

With 4.2.1 I am still facing incompatibility with zip=0.6 as mentioned in #2872. They seems to have fixed the issue in Git but not yet created a release, so using `zip = { git = "https://github.com/zip-rs/zip" }` resolves the issue.

> With 4.2.1 I am still facing incompatibility with zip=0.6 as mentioned in #2872. They seems to have fixed the issue in Git but not yet created a release, so using `zip = { git = "https://github.com/zip-rs/zip" }` resolves the issue.

Isn't that an issue around zstd? If so, it's completely unrelated to this issue.

> > With 4.2.1 I am still facing incompatibility with zip=0.6 as mentioned in #2872. They seems to have fixed the issue in Git but not yet created a release, so using `zip = { git = "https://github.com/zip-rs/zip" }` resolves the issue.
> 
> Isn't that an issue around zstd? If so, it's completely unrelated to this issue.

yes, issue with zstd
